channel.title: Matrix client stuck on checking for updates 0%
channel.description: anyone know the fix? this was after we tried making it a downloadable client?

item.title: Matrix client stuck on checking for updates 0%
item.dc:creator: @NathDzn NathDzn
item.description:
@NathDzn wrote:

make sure you change your client ip to your no-ip or your vps ip
127.0.0.1 is your local ip therefor will not work for others

item.source: Matrix client stuck on checking for updates 0%

item.title: Matrix client stuck on checking for updates 0%
item.dc:creator: @ildarkelly ildarkelly
item.description:
@ildarkelly wrote:

I didnt jar the client, what i did was i made a no-ip.org then i copied the client (to give to other people) i kept my settings.java in the client at 127.0.0.1. Everytime i tried running the client it was stuck on the same error message. I then downloaded the client from the website ( so the client hasnt been touched) and tried running the client and it still had the same problem. Do i need to manually put the cache into my c drive or is it something i may have changed on my source??

Thanks for your help!

Read full topic
item.source: Matrix client stuck on checking for updates 0%

item.title: Matrix client stuck on checking for updates 0%
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Did you jar the download client? If so, you either didn’t place the cache in the directory or the cache included became/was corrupt.
If not, check that your source is being run and is using the compatible client.

Read full topic
item.source: Matrix client stuck on checking for updates 0%

item.title: Matrix client stuck on checking for updates 0%
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

I’m not really familiar with client problems, however I believe it’s cache-related. Make sure that your cache is in the correct place, it really depends on the client as some read it from the C:/ drive while others have it in the same directory.

Read full topic
